perturbation.original_text: Each Purchase Customer will be required to purchase twelve months of local numeric airtime at a rate of $10.33 per month through a designated nationwide airtime provider, prepaid in advance. The purchased airtime shall be non-refundable to the consumer. Additionally, Purchase Customers will be required to pay for shipping and handling costs and applicable sales taxes based on their locations.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Purchase Customer may purchase twelve months of local numeric airtime at a rate of $10.33 per month through a designated nationwide airtime provider, prepaid in advance. The purchased airtime shall be refundable to the consumer under certain conditions outlined by the airtime provider. Additionally, Purchase Customers will be required to pay for shipping and handling costs and applicable sales taxes based on their locations.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that airtime purchase is required and non-refundable, while the modified text makes it optional ('may purchase') and potentially refundable. This creates a contradiction about the core financial obligation of the Purchase Customer.

perturbation.original_text: This promotion shall begin on June 1,1999 and shall terminate June 1, 2000 (herein "Term") This term shall be extended for a 1 year period provided 3000 pagers per month are distributed to Purchase customers.
perturbation.changed_text: This promotion shall begin on June 1,1999 and shall terminate June 1, 2000 (herein "Term") This term may be extended indefinitely based on the sole discretion of PageMaster Corporation, regardless of the number of pagers distributed.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement stipulates a specific condition (3000 pagers/month distribution) for a 1-year extension. The modified text removes this condition and grants PageMaster Corporation complete and unconditional discretion over the extension, which potentially contradicts the originally agreed-upon conditions for the term extension, creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: PageMaster Corporation will contract with a nationwide airtime service provider to fulfill and to ship Purchasing Customer orders direct to the Purchase Customers to fulfill this promotion in a timely manner. PageMaster Corporation has chosen for the purpose of this promotion, MetroCall Inc. to provide pager and airtime services where the nationwide airtime service provider has the facilities and the requisite governmental authority to provide such services. All Purchase Customers shall become customers of the nationwide airtime service provider. The nationwide airtime service provider shall be allowed to market additional pagers arid enhanced services to all Purchase Customers, and to charge for over-calls with respect to any account with a Purchase Customer. The nationwide airtime service provider shall be able to discontinue or terminate service to any Purchase Customer in accordance with the terms of the contract between the nationwide airtime service provider and the Purchase Customer. Notwithstanding the foregoing, PageMaster Corporation shall remain solely responsible for the fulfillment of all services and obligations set forth in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: PageMaster Corporation will endeavor to contract with a nationwide airtime service provider to fulfill and to ship Purchasing Customer orders directly to the Purchase Customers to fulfill this promotion. PageMaster Corporation may consider MetroCall Inc. to provide pager and airtime services where a nationwide airtime service provider has the facilities and the requisite governmental authority to provide such services. Purchase Customers might become customers of a nationwide airtime service provider. The nationwide airtime service provider may market additional pagers and enhanced services to all Purchase Customers, and could charge for over-calls with respect to any account with a Purchase Customer. The nationwide airtime service provider is not required to discontinue or terminate service to any Purchase Customer in accordance with the terms of the contract between the nationwide airtime service provider and the Purchase Customer. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the responsibilities of PageMaster Corporation for the fulfillment of services and obligations set forth in this Agreement are shared equally with the airtime service provider.
perturbation.explanation: The original text makes PageMaster Corporation solely responsible for fulfillment despite the airtime provider's involvement. The modified text softens PageMaster's obligation to contract, makes customer status optional ('might become'), and, most importantly, shares fulfillment responsibilities with the airtime service provider. This contradicts the original allocation of responsibility.
